title: I Want These $20 Walmart Pillows in All 5 Colors (They're So Good!)
description: Let the relaxation begin. READ MORE...
author: Isabel Petrou
text: DecoratingDecor & AccessoriesShoppingIsabel PetrouIsabel PetrouIsabel is an incoming sophomore at the University of Vermont studying public communication. She grew up in Portsmouth, Rhode Island, where she frequented the beach often during the summer. All prices were accurate at the time of publishing.Is Walmart becoming my new favorite home decor spot? I think so after seeing these gorgeous 20‚Äùx20‚Äù floor pillows!¬†Instagrammer Alyssa Lockerbie (@cozyalyssa) made a whole Reel dedicated to Walmart‚Äôs recent decor releases, including the floor pillows, and everything goes together beautifully. One commenter wrote, ‚ÄúNo way üòç I need it all.‚Äù Which just about sums it up!¬†The pillows are particular standouts and come in so many colors: lilac (seen in the Reel above), blue, gold, rose, and seafoam green.¬† If I had to choose one, I would lean toward the golden yellow color because it matches the earthy, vintage vibe of my apartment. But honestly, I would get them all!The floor pillows are made from 100% velvet polyester, which gives them a sleek, soft, and sophisticated finish ‚Äî¬†truly, they‚Äôre extremely elegant. When I look at these floor pillows, I get castle-y, old-timey vibes. Displaying them in my room would make me feel like royalty.¬†Oh, and by the way, they‚Äôre only $19.97 each.¬†Floor pillows work so well in a dorm when you have friends over for a movie night or any other hang. Often, dorms lack enough seating, but you could pull out these floor pillows¬†to ensure all your guests feel comfortable. They‚Äôre not too-too big, and they‚Äôre soft, so that means you can more easily store them. I would put them under my bed or in the closet. You could potentially even stash one or two in that sliver of space between your bed and your desk.They‚Äôd serve you way past the dorms, too. My college apartment only has one small couch that barely fits three, so when we have movie nights with eight or so other friends, everyone ends up on the floor. If I had these floor pillows, I wouldn‚Äôt constantly worried that my guests are uncomfortable. Absolute bonus: They would create the look of a cute little slumber party moment!

Isabel is an incoming sophomore at the University of Vermont studying public communication. She grew up in Portsmouth, Rhode Island, where she frequented the beach often during the summer. Even though her heart belongs to the ocean, the mountains are becoming a close contender.‚Ä¶read more

published now

We independently select these products‚Äîif you buy from one of our links, we may earn a commission. All prices were accurate at the time of publishing.

Is Walmart becoming my new favorite home decor spot? I think so after seeing these gorgeous 20‚Äùx20‚Äù floor pillows!¬†

Instagrammer Alyssa Lockerbie (@cozyalyssa) made a whole Reel dedicated to Walmart‚Äôs recent decor releases, including the floor pillows, and everything goes together beautifully. One commenter wrote, ‚ÄúNo way üòç I need it all.‚Äù Which just about sums it up!¬†

The pillows are particular standouts and come in so many colors: lilac (seen in the Reel above), blue, gold, rose, and seafoam green.¬† If I had to choose one, I would lean toward the golden yellow color because it matches the earthy, vintage vibe of my apartment. But honestly, I would get them all!

The floor pillows are made from 100% velvet polyester, which gives them a sleek, soft, and sophisticated finish ‚Äî¬†truly, they‚Äôre extremely elegant. When I look at these floor pillows, I get castle-y, old-timey vibes. Displaying them in my room would make me feel like royalty.¬†

Oh, and by the way, they‚Äôre only $19.97 each.¬†

Floor pillows work so well in a dorm when you have friends over for a movie night or any other hang. Often, dorms lack enough seating, but you could pull out these floor pillows¬†to ensure all your guests feel comfortable. They‚Äôre not too-too big, and they‚Äôre soft, so that means you can more easily store them. I would put them under my bed or in the closet. You could potentially even stash one or two in that sliver of space between your bed and your desk.

They‚Äôd serve you way past the dorms, too. My college apartment only has one small couch that barely fits three, so when we have movie nights with eight or so other friends, everyone ends up on the floor. If I had these floor pillows, I wouldn‚Äôt constantly worried that my guests are uncomfortable. Absolute bonus: They would create the look of a cute little slumber party moment!¬†
